name: 勞維俊
objective:
Technology and Modern Literature

By close readings of cultural texts including literature, film, architecture and the city, this course examines the relationship between technology, culture and modernity, exploring the extent to which technology could be regarded as neutral and progressive. Informed by critical theory, this course examines how technology shapes our ways of seeing, conception of ourselves, and relationship with others.

Assessment: 
Participation　　　　　　　　　　 　　　　　　　　　　　　　　10%
Mid-term paper　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　30%
Group presentation 　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　20%
Final paper 　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　40%
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　   100%　　
Mid-term paper:
Write an essay on a topic discussed during weeks 1-8. Possible essay titles will be announced during the lectures. The essay should focus on one cultural text and at least one cultural critic studied.

Final paper:
Write an essay on a topic discussed after the mid-term, during weeks 10-15. The essay should focus on one cultural text. You may compare it with a text discussed during weeks 1-8, but do not repeat yourself.

Group Presentation:
The group should consist of 2-3 students, on a chosen topic which allows critical analysis of an everyday issue concerning technology. Grades will be given to those who demonstrate application of the theories learnt. Possible topics will be announced during the lectures. Students should not repeat the topic discussed in the mid-term paper.

Site visit:
A site visit may be arranged. Possible activities: Museum visit, city field study, including shopping mall, park, library, transportation network, etc. Details to be confirmed.
